title: Conference calls
text:
THE NATION July 29, 2015 1:00 am 
Eastin Tan Hotel Chiang Mai is offering special meeting package. Eastin Tan Hotel Chiang Mai is offering special meeting packages that start at Bt700 for a half-day meeting with coffee break and lunch. CHIANG MAI Conference calls Eastin Tan Hotel Chiang Mai , the newest 4-star property in the Eastin chain of international hotels and residences, is offering special meeting packages that start at Bt700 for a half-day meeting with coffee break and lunch. The rate for full day meeting starts from Bt800 per person with two coffee breaks and one lunch. The offer is available from August 1 to October 31. Call (052) 001 999 or e-mail: sales@eastintanchiangmai.com. Visit www.EastinTanChiangMai.com. BANGKOK Sweet suites The Okura Prestige Bangkok has launched a new Suite Escapes Package starting at Bt17,700 per room per night. The package includes a choice of daily buffet breakfast at Up & Above or Japanese set breakfast at Yamazato, complimentary laundry/pressing, high speed Internet access and unlimited use of the hotel's exclusive Okura Club Lounge with all-day refreshments, Japanese tea corner, evening cocktails, free use of Meeting Room and the added incentive of a Bt2,000 voucher redeemable at any of the hotel's restaurants or at The Okura Spa. The offer applies to reservations made for either a Deluxe Suite or a Prestige Suite for two consecutive nights before December 31. Call (02) 687 9000 or e-mail: reservations@okurabangkok.com. So pampered This August, celebrate Mother's Day by treating mum to a "So Pampering" treatment at So Spa on the 11th floor of Sofitel So Bangkok, The offer, which is priced at Bt3,900, includes a foot ritual, red Jasmine Rice Scrub and aromatic Jasmine massage. Advance reservations are highly recommended. Call (02) 6240000 or e-mail: H6835-TH2@Sofitel.com. PHUKET Perfect escape Make a perfect getaway from the metropolitan buzz at Grand Mercure Phuket Patong and enjoy an exclusive room rate that's applicable to all Thai residents and resident expatriates. The costs are Bt 2,999 per night for superior room and Bt 4,999 per night for deluxe pool access room. The rates include buffet breakfast for two persons, complimentary welcome drink and choux pastry, 10-per-cent discount on the excursion offer and complimentary Wi-Fi. Don't forget to flash your ID card or valid Thai work permit upon check in. The deal is good until October 31. |Call (076) 231 999 or e-mail: h8109@accor.com. HONG KONG Meeting Marco Polo Strategically located in Canton Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, the three harbourside Marco Polo hotels in Hong Kong - Marco Polo Hong Kong, Gateway and Prince Hotels - offer a variety of well-appointed function rooms featuring spacious foyers and state-of-the-art facilities. Confirm a MICE event with a total minimum spending of HK$115,000 on accommodation only for groups with a minimum of 20 rooms on any one day with any usage of function spaces before December 31, and the organiser receives a complimentary iPad mini. Full day rates per person range from HK$600 to HK$700 while half day rates per person go from HK$500 to HK$560. Call (852) 2113 3203 or |e-mail: mice.hkh@marcopolohotels.com. BALI Decadent in black Alila Villas Soori, located on the southwest coast of Bali presents a luxurious 96 Hours Blackout themed stay. Over 96 hours, guests are eased into 16 decadent and transformative spa treatments, including "Black Sweetness," a soothing steam bath and skin treatment of honey mixed with black pearl powder, "Stars Unfold," a relaxing bedtime warm stone massage under the stars, and "Black Reflection," a rejuvenating therapeutic massage involving two masseuses working in perfect balance and harmony. The package starts at US$38,888. Visit www.AlilaHotels.com/soori or e-mail: soori@alilahotels.com. 239 Viewed
